title: Metropolis (1927)
text: A silent German expressionist film masterpiece, set in a futuristic urban dystopia divided between the working class and the city planners. It is a landmark of early science fiction cinema.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968)
text: Directed by Stanley Kubrick, this film is a seminal work in the sci-fi genre, known for its scientifically accurate depiction of space travel, groundbreaking visual effects, and ambiguous narrative exploring human evolution and artificial intelligence.

title: Blade Runner (1982)
text: A neo-noir science fiction film directed by Ridley Scott, based on Philip K. Dick's novel 'Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?'. It explores themes of identity, humanity, and ethics in a dystopian future Los Angeles.
